website_summaries.verdict: With a wide-angle, megazoom lens, a quick AF system, and generally high-quality snapshot photos, the Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZR1 is a standout compact megazoom.

customer_reviews.title: Its what I expected
customer_reviews.text: After all the reviews stating that the camera took bad indoor shots I was a little worried that I might have purchased the wrong camera that cnet spoke so highly of. I found the in door shots to be natural looking without a lot of light brighting up areas that are dark to begin with. The picture I took look exactly like I see it. I love this camera its a perfect replacement for my old like new condition Olympus D40.
customer_reviews.author: T. King

customer_reviews.title: Love the Lumix
customer_reviews.text: Have had an array of the cheap little point n' shoot cameras, and even though I still don't consider myself an expert by any means, this Panasonic Lumix has been far and away the best one yet. It's easy to use and takes great pictures. I was skeptical about the proprietary (rather than AA) battery, but so far, it hasn't been a problem. Lastly, I wouldn't install the uploading/editing software they send with it (it was pretty clunky), go with what comes with your computer.
customer_reviews.author: reerc

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Lumix Camera
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a camera that would easily fit into a small purse or pocket that I could take with me when visiting, vacationing etc. I love this camera and have not even used half of the features available on it yet. The photos are great and the zoom feature is fine for my needs. Much more convenient to have a small camera instead of having to carry a larger camera and case along with a purse when I leave the house.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle K.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing - especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: This camera is amazing. I bought it because I am about to have my very first child and I wanted a new camera so I could capture as many precious moments as possible. I did a lot of research and found that this camera was very highly rated/recommended by CNET. The high def video is amazing and the camera takes not only high quality pictures, but it takes them really quickly. Really great deal for the price!
customer_reviews.author: dande2169

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: After doing a CONSIDERABLE amount of research on this type of camera, I finally decided on this unit. It was rated very high by Consumer Reports and many websites such as C-Net. I have not been disappointed yet. It seems very easy to use right out of the box and seems to perform as described. We haven't owned it long, but I'm sure we will be very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Camera
customer_reviews.text: I used this camera for just under three years every day at work. I ran over 17k exposures through it and then passed it down to my Assistant when I upgraded to a Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS 10. ¡It continues to work very well every day!
customer_reviews.author: Dan T. L.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: For this price (especially the refurbished unit), it is the best deal for the buck. It is MUCH smaller and lighter than other cameras out there that produce similar quality photographs. If you are looking for a camera that is both small/light, takes good quality pictures, and is not expensive, then you can't go wrong with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: MattA

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little camera to fit in your pocket.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to take on a cross country trip last year. I was looking for something that had some of the advanced features you'd find in an advanced point and shoot, but still wanted it to fit in my front pocket comfortably. For the most part, it does just what I needed it to do. My only complaint is with low-light pictures. There tends to be a lot of noise in the photos. Other than that, its a solid device. I really like the size and the convenience. Its def. worth having along with you to take pictures that you want to come out stronger than your phone camera.
customer_reviews.author: Likesstufftowork

customer_reviews.title: Really nice camera
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday gift for a teenage girl. She uses it on a regular basis and feels lost without it. It works great and is the envy of all her friends because of the telephoto quality. Video features are great as well. It was delivered quickly and as promised. Thank you Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine

customer_reviews.title: An Amazing Little Camera
customer_reviews.text: I have a Nikon SLR, a Sony HD video camera... and the Panasonic is the one I am always using. For a pocket camera, it takes great pictures and video. The only downside is that I probably won't be using my other much more "expensive" cameras very much.
customer_reviews.author: IamJack

customer_reviews.title: Great camera except in low light
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera for the price. I use it for real estate pictures. The wide angle lense definitely captures more with little to no distortion. However, this camera does not perform well in low light conditions. I don't take pictures any of my interior real estate pictures on cloudy days with this camera. Overall good quality camera, quick start up, excellent photo quality in all but low light conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great pocket camera
customer_reviews.text: I only had this camera for a couple of weeks before it was stolen out of my suitcase (never again). But I loved it in every way. Only weakness (pointed out in reviews) is that the mode dial often turned while in my pocket.
customer_reviews.author: S. Pogoloff

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZR1
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little compact camera that takes great pictures. I only wish the product information would have given details on the date/time stamp feature. I wanted a camera with the ability to have the date/time stamp if I decided to turn the feature on. This camera does not allow for this option. If I want the date/time stamp, I have to manually place it on each picture. This process requires about 4 steps for each and every picture. To top it off, if I want the date/stamp on the photo, it will only save it as a 2 megapixel picture.
customer_reviews.author: J. Regalado

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. It's user friendly and takes really good pictures. I took a few videos of my sons band at a festival and I was pleased with the quality of the picture and the sound.
customer_reviews.author: PJR

customer_reviews.title: Dust on CCD
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera just over a year ago. All of the sudden there are black spots on my pictures due to dust on the ccd. Panasonic said it would cost $120 to fix. A friend of mine had the same problem with his same type of camera. Also, Panasonic's customer service said they have received calls on the same issue. This is poor customer service for something that is clearly a major design flaw. I will never buy another Panasonic camera.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Best Compact yet
customer_reviews.text: I have owned many cams, This is one of the best for its size and price. Very good zoom even in macro mode. Photo quality much better than I expected. iA Does an excellent job, No worries. Highly recommended! I use this cam 90% of the time the G10 10%. It's always in my pocket.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gylland

customer_reviews.title: Great camera design, POOR PHOTO QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: I spent weeks reviewing cameras and chose the ZR1... I love the contruction and the interface is easy to use-- many great scene modes. The pictures looked great on the camera's LCD screen, but once I uploaded them to my computer I realized they were not as crisp as I had hoped. I tried many different settings and most pictures appeared blurry or washed out. Luckily I purchased the camera through Amazon and was able to return it. Back to analyzing camera reviews...
customer_reviews.author: K. Keller

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: It takes great pictures and videos. The only negative is that in bright light it is difficult to see the image on the screen when taking a picture.
customer_reviews.author: Wayzataboy

customer_reviews.title: great picture  colors are alive
customer_reviews.text: Great little toy, fun to use lots of setting to get just the right one for u i'm sure!!! size is excellent will fit anywhere, colors are amazing. I love it very happy with my choice would do it again !!! did lots of study before making it i get an A for home work. Reta ( NEVIS )
customer_reviews.author: BIG CAT

customer_reviews.title: small cam for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for on the go shots, good zoom for such a small cam and great price.
customer_reviews.author: Roland

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera with dast shutter speed
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent camera as customer reviews indicated and the shutter speed is the fasted among this type of camera. They don't make them this fast any more.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: All I expected
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this camera because it had a greater optical zoom than most cameras(10X), plus further digital zoom. It has a higher pixel count than the others in it's class who had slightly larger zoom lenses. Not overly feature rich, but then how much do you really use them. Good size, able to control one handed and focuses quickly with good re-cycle time on the flash. Haven't really used the video other to try it out, but with 12 megapixels, would think it is adequate. Only drawback is the actual trigger for the picture could be a little easier to find, but that is pretty picky.
customer_reviews.author: Gary L. Kolbe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera, you get high quality photos and videos. The approach works wonderfully. I am very happy with this camera and I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Leon Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Lumix camera
customer_reviews.text: I like the features and especially the zoom. The package size is small and I can keep the camera in my pocket. I'm learning how to use the many features.
customer_reviews.author: John P. Post Sr.

customer_reviews.title: So far its a go.
customer_reviews.text: I can't say a lot as I have not had a chance to use this camera very much yet. So far I like everything about it that I have gotten to use. Good picture quality. Easy to work with. So very light to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: great camera, and gorgeous!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera a couple months ago...and have taken more pictures in that time than I have in the past three years. It is just so tempting to take out this small, gorgeous camera and snap a photo. Would totally recommend it. Though I haven't really messed with the features, I am sure I can take even more amazing pictures if I learned how to really use the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Mango 25

customer_reviews.title: All you could ever need without bumping up to a DSLR
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic camera, shoots quick, starts up quick, quality is great even when set to 3 or 5 megapixles. its light, small, durable, and stylish. everything is easy to figure out and use.
customer_reviews.author: Shredder

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Lumix Camera
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good camera. The 8x zoom is fantastic. Menu items are a bit hard to navigate for the uninitiated.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Sopo

customer_reviews.title: Lumix DMC-ZR1
customer_reviews.text: Over all good product. Build is second to none. I own other Lumix products, this is on par with them. Some times the pictures are not great in auto or Ai mode.
customer_reviews.author: J. Crum

customer_reviews.title: Lumix zr1
customer_reviews.text: 'I bought this camera for its portability. I am constantly surprised by its picture quality, and versatility. This is a really great product
customer_reviews.author: plvan

customer_reviews.title: Simple and efficient
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent dummy proof camera. Easy menus and features. Excellent zoom, very quiet and the video quality is great.
customer_reviews.author: BostonOnline

customer_reviews.title: DMZ-ZR1 - not a bad buy
customer_reviews.text: Takes nice pictures. Very good price point for a 12MP camera. Very compact. No frills. Does not include a CF disk or carrying case. Most pictures are fine although not the best in either action shots or low light. Still, I'm impressed for what it does offer and considering I upgraded from a very old 2MP camera, this is leaps and bounds above that.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Such a challenge to hold
customer_reviews.text: After much research and reading a zillion reviews I decided to order this camera. I never found one in person to hold or I would have made a different selection. The camera is super small so it fits perfectly in a pocket. However I can barely use it. There is nothing to grip and right where I want to put my thumb is a button that makes the camera zoom all the way out. Poor design. It is also not as quick as the stats led me to expect but it is faster than the Canon I was replacing. Outside, natural light photos are very good. Indoor, flash pictures are just so-so. I would not recommend it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: S. Burke

customer_reviews.title: Good camera
customer_reviews.text: I like this camera a lot. Performs as expected after much research. Small size is very easy to take anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy J. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: We bought this camera for an upcoming vacation. We haven't gone yet so not sure how it will do. But the pictures we have taken around the house have come out very well. Haven't figures out all the features yet, but the ones we have used worked well.
customer_reviews.author: just a shopper

customer_reviews.title: Like another reviewer said...
customer_reviews.text: Like one of the other reviewers said, this camera looks good on paper, but the picture quality doesn't come close to other P&S cameras. I've used Casio and Canon before and they both took good pics. I still have an SD550 (7.1MP) and it takes much better shots than this Panasonic. The noise and lack of sharpness in the panasonic pictures was more than I could handle. If I could, I would post the two pictures I took (one with SD550 and one with DMC-ZR1). If it wasn't for the smaller size of the Canon pic, you'd swear it was from the newer camera. I just printed out the return shipping label.
customer_reviews.author: GC

customer_reviews.title: POOOOR indoor images
customer_reviews.text: really really bad indoor picture quality. uncomparable with any other digital camera.. my six year old olypus c4000 took way way better pictures. ZR1 gave me the worst experience I could receive from a digital camera. I will return the ZR1 as I received a ZS3 which is comparable to other cameras in the market ( i mean its way way better than a ZR1) don't be fooled by the reviews...they compare picture quality in good lighting (not even slightly bad lighting).... and Dpreview and the top reviewers did not review it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Sartaz

customer_reviews.title: Be careful, one drop and you'll be shopping for a new camera!
customer_reviews.text: Loved the camera, great pictures, hd video, features and a huge zoom for a compact camera. Only issue is I dropped the camera once on a wood floor, the zoom got bent and now it won't close or take pictures. Disappointed in the fragile construction of the zoom lens. Took about 50 pics and one drop later I was in Mexico for 10 days without a working camera.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Zajac

product_meta.title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZR1 12.1MP Digital Camera with 8x POWER Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7 inch LCD (Black)
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackFROM THE MANUFACTURER


 The Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZR1 digital camera features the world’s first 0.3mm thin aspherical lens, allowing for a compact body that still features a powerful, 25mm-ultra-wide-angle, 8x optical zoom Leica DC Vario-Elmar lens. Known for its long-zoom, yet compact digital cameras, Panasonic’s newest ZR1 compact digital camera delivers increased flexibility. 

With a zoom range of 25-200mm, the ZR1 allows for both expansive scenery photos as well as close-ups. This powerful zoom also works during video recording. The 12.1-megapixel resolution allows photos to be greatly enlarged while still retaining outstanding detail. 

Another key feature of the ZR1 is its fast, high-speed Auto Focus (AF). This, combined with a high-speed start-up of only 1.1 second, helps the ZR1 to catch even the quick action shots. Making this camera even more versatile and easy-to-use, the ZR1 has a 2.7-inch Intelligent LCD, and a powerful battery life with the highly energy-efficient image processing LSI--Venus Engine V--which takes approximately 330 pictures during a single charge. As found in all Panasonic Lumix cameras, the ZR1 features Intelligent Auto (iA) Mode, now with POWER Optical Image Stabilizer (O.I.S.), which features double the repression power, compared to MEGA O.I.S., the previous image stabilization system, to help capture blur-free images. 

Ultra-clear 8x zoom, Power O.I.S., and a 25mm wide-angle Leica DC Vario-Elmar lens
The compact body of the ZR1 houses a Leica DC Vario-Elmar lens that ranges from 25mm wide-angle all the way to 200mm telephoto. In addition to its superb image rendering, the Leica DC lens lets you capture photos clearly without having to worry about hand-shake in all kinds of travel situations, thanks to the double* corrective power of Power O.I.S. as compared to previous models.
*Panasonic comparison 

High-speed performance captures every shooting opportunity
Enjoy high-speed 1.1-second start-ups, AF speeds of approximately 0.27 second, and up to five consecutive shots at 2.3 frames per second with full resolution. You can also take up to 330 photos with a single battery charge (CIPA). This comfortable level of performance lets you capture even the most fleeting shutter chances. 

Let iA mode do all the work--get stunning shots every time
Simply switch to iA mode, and leave everything up to the camera. It automatically activates six detection and correction functions including Power O.I.S., and lets you easily preserve your magnificent travel memories. 

My Travel mode sorts your travel memories
The camera automatically arranges photos and movies using data such as the dates and locations of where they were taken. This makes it easier to enjoy your travel images in slideshows of photos and movies. 

Additional Features 

 * Additional Intelligent Auto (iA) Mode Features 
 * Hand-Shake Component: Answers the problem of natural hand-shaking that goes along with pressing the shutter button. 
 * Face Recognition: Up to six faces can be registered, and up to three can be simultaneously recognized to show their names once registered. 
 * Travel Mode: Users can quickly organize information related to travel, including destination, date and time. Playback of these photos is just as easy, by designating the date or period of travel on the calendar menu interface. 
 * High Dynamic Mode: Helps to capture a scene with moderate exposure even when the scene may contain both bright and dark areas. 
 * PHOTOfunSTUDIO 4.0: Included software allows the user to view, edit and archive captured photos and videos. It features dramatic speed-up of operation and also allows users to store and sort photos by a specific, recognized face in the image.
feature_bullets: 25mm wide-angle Leica DC Vario-Elmar lens; 8x zoom, Power O.I.S.
Capture images to SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars87 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
